description: RETROSPECTIVE CONSENT FOR RAISING OF RIDGE HEIGHT OVER THE MAIN PORTION OF THE HOUSE; REVISED STAIRCASE GLAZING ON THE WEST ELEVATION; REVISED ROOFLIGHTS ON THE WEST ELEVATION; ADDITIONAL ROOFLIGHT ON THE FRONT ELEVATION SLOPE; RENDERING OF DWELLINGHOUSE AND  GLAZING TO BE IN ANTHRACITE UPVC FRAMES; THE FRONT DOOR, SIDE AND TOP GLAZING REPLACED WITH A 2.4 X 1M SECURED BY DESIGN DOOR IN AN ANTHRACITE COLOUR.
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - In the absence of accurate drawings, officers have not been able to ascertain the extent of development on the character and appearance of the host site or surrounding area, as such the proposal is considered to contradict with the principles of, in particular, policies DMD2 and DMD3 of the Adopted Site and Policies Plan 2014, CS 14 of the LBM Core Strategy 2011 and D3 and D4 of the London Plan 2021 as well as the NPPF.

Reason : 2 - In the absence of accurate drawings, officers have not been able to ascertain the extent of development on the amenities of neighbouring occupiers, as such the proposal is considered to contradict with the principles of, in particular, policy DMD2 of the Adopted Site and Policies Plan 2014.

Reason : 3 - In the absence of drawings and details of the air conditioning units, the proposed air conditioning units is considered to have a detrimental impact on the character and appearance of the host site and surrounding area, as such the proposal contradicts with the principles of, in particular, policies DMD2 and DMD3 of the Adopted Site and Policies Plan 2014, CS 14 of the LBM Core Strategy 2011 and D3 and D4 of the London Plan 2021 as well as the NPPF.

Reason : 4 - In the absence of a flood risk assessment, the scheme has failed to demonstrate that it would not increase risk of flooding in the locality, contrary to, in particular, London Plan policy SI 13, LBM Core Strategy 2011 policy CS16 and Adopted Site and Policies Plan 2014 policies DM F1 and DM F2.

Reason : 5 - In the absence of an acoustic assessment, it has not been satisfactorily demonstrated that the residential amenity of nearby occupants has been safeguarded. The proposal is contrary to, in particular, Merton's Sites and Policies Plan policies DM D2 and DM EP2.

Reason : 6 - **INFORMATIVE**
You shall be made aware that the council have planning enforcement case ref nos 23/E0012, 23/E0040, 23/E0119 and officers may review formal action if the breach is not remedied
